Qualpal generates optimally distinct color palettes for qualitative data
visualization. It uses color theory and perceptual models
to create palettes where colors are maximally distinguishable to the human eye,
while allowing precise control over hue, lightness, and chroma ranges.

The package is particularly useful when you need more than the 8-12 colors that
standard palettes provide, or when you want to ensure colors work well for
colorblind viewers. Try the [web app](https://qualpal.cc) for interactive
palette exploration, or install the R package for programmatic use in your data
visualization workflows.
